channel.title: Professionals on Alexander Marquardt
channel.description: Recent content in Professionals on Alexander Marquardt

item.description:
Professional Record and Publications

This page provides supporting material for my professional background, including selected publications, patents, open-source contributions, and formal education.

Profiles

  • LinkedIn Profile

  • Github page

Recognition

  • Author of three papers that were selected to be amongst the 25 most significant FPGA papers of the past 20 years at the 20th anniversary of the International Symposium on Field-Programmable Gate Arrays in 2012.

Scientific Publications

The publications listed below have been cited over 3600 times according to Google Scholar. These publications reflect early work in FPGA architecture, placement, and routing algorithms.

item.title: Patents
item.description:
Method and system for estimating the reliability of blacklists of botnet-infected computers

  • US patent 8,516,595.
  • Issued Aug 20, 2013
  • See patent.

Versatile logic element and logic array block

  • US patent 7,218,133
  • Issued May 15, 2007 
  • See patent.

Routing Architecture For A Programmable Logic Device

  • US patent 6,970,014 
  • Issued Nov 29, 2005
  • See patent.

item.title: Publications
item.description:
Book

Architecture and CAD for Deep Sub-Micron FPGAs

  • Mar 1999 – This book covers the software and hardware that is used for architecting and programming/re-configuring FPGAs.
  • See book on Amazon.com.
  • Cited by 1402 scientific publications as of October 2017.

Thesis

Cluster-Based Architecture, Timing-Driven Packing, and Timing-Driven Placement for FPGAs

  • Apr 1999 – M.A.Sc Thesis - National Library of Canada.
  • See publication.
  • Cited by 15 scientific publications as of October 2017.

Scientific Papers

The Stratix II Logic and Routing Architecture

  • Nov 2005  -- ACM/Sigda 13th International Symposium on Field-Programmabel Gate Arrays
  • See publication.
  • Cited by 213 scientific publications as of October 2017.

The Stratix Routing and Logic Architecture

  • Feb 2003  -- ACM/Sigda International Symposium on Field-Programmable Gate Arrays, 2003
  • See publication.
  • Voted as one of the 25 most significant FPGA papers of the past 20 years at the 20th anniversary of the International Symposium on Field-Programmable Gate Arrays in 2012. See endorsement.
  • Cited by 146 scientific publications as of October 2017.

Speed and Area Trade-Offs in Cluster-Based FPGA Architectures

  • Feb 2000  -- IEEE Transactions on VLSI
  • See publication.
  • Cited by 72 scientific publications as of October 2017.

Timing-Driven Placement for FPGAs

  • Feb 2000 – Proc. 8th. ACM/SIGDA Intl. Symposium on FPGAs.
  • See publication.
  • Voted as one of the 25 most significant FPGA papers of the past 20 years at the 20th anniversary of the International Symposium on Field-Programmable Gate Arrays in 2012. See endorsement.
  • Cited by 285 scientific publications as of October 2017.

Using Cluster Based Logic Blocks and Timing-Driven Packing to Improve FPGA Speed and Density

  • Feb 1999  -- Proc. 7th ACM/SIGDA Intl. Symposium on FPGAs
  • See publication.
  • Voted as one of the 25 most significant FPGA papers of the past 20 years at the 20th anniversary of the International Symposium on Field-Programmable Gate Arrays in 2012. See endorsement.
  • Cited by 264 scientific publications as of October 2017.
